Mau Naik Kelas, Bank Royal Bakal Disuntik BCA Rp 700 Miliar
06 Nov 2019, 09:54 by Danang Sugianto


Foto: Ari Saputra

Jakarta - PT Bank Central Asia Tbk (BCA) telah resmi menjadi pemilik PT Bank Royal Indonesia. Setelah membeli sahamnya, BCA berniat untuk menyuntikkan modal hingga Rp 700 miliar.Presiden Direktur BCA Jahja Setiaatmadja mengatakan, Bank Royal Indonesia nantinya akan dijadikan BCA sebagai anak usaha yang fokus ke segmen perbankan digital. Nah untuk menggarap bisnis itu Bank Royal Indonesia masih belum bisa karena masih dalam kategori bank BUKU I."Kita nanti lihat kebutuhannya, jadi kalau memang butuh untuk cepat ekspansi ya kita akan tambah modal. Yang jelas kita siapkan untuk jadi BUKU 2. Karena kalau digital harus BUKU 2, jadi kita kana siapkan untuk jadi bank BUKU 2," ujarnya di Hotel Fairmont, Jakarta Selatan, Rabu (6/11/2019).BCA sendiri sebelumnya mengumumkan telah menandatangani perjanjian jual beli yang telah mendapatkan persetujuan efektif dari Otoritas Jasa Keuangan (OJK). Dengan perjanjian akta jual beli itu 99,99% saham Bank Royal telah menjadi milik BCA dan 0,01% menjadi milik PT BCA Finance.Jahja menjelaskan, saat mengakuisisi penuh saham Bank Royal Indonesia modal intinya hanya Rp 300 miliar. Sementara BCA membeli saham Bank Royal Indonesia sekitar Rp 988 miliar yang masuk ke pemilik sebelumnya."Kemarin kan intinya Rp 300 miliar, kita beli 2,8 kali jadi sekitar Rp 1 triliun. Tapi kita harus tetap inject jadi Rp 1 triliun modal dasarnya," tambahnya.Untuk melayani perbankan digital, Bank Royal harus menjadi BUKU 2. Sementara untuk menjadi bank BUKU 2 dibutuhkan modal inti minimal Rp 1 triliun."(Ditambahkan) Rp 700-an miliar lah," ujarnya.Jahja memperkirakan dana yang akan disuntikkan ke Bank Royal Indonesia sekitar Rp 700 miliar. Going Up to Class, Bank Royal Will Be Injected by BCA at Rp 700 Billion
Nov 6, 2019, 09:54 by Danang Sugianto


Photo: Ari Saputra

Jakarta - PT Bank Central Asia Tbk (BCA) has officially become the owner of PT Bank Royal Indonesia. After buying its shares, BCA intends to inject capital of up to Rp 700 billion. BCA's President Director Jahja Setiaatmadja said, Bank Royal Indonesia will later become BCA as a subsidiary that focuses on the digital banking segment. Now to work on the business, Bank Royal Indonesia still cannot because it is still in the category of BUKU I bank. "We will see the needs later, so if we really need to quickly expand, we will add capital. What is clear is that we prepare to become BOOK 2. Because if digital BUKU 2 must, so we can prepare it to become a BUKU 2 bank, "he said at the Fairmont Hotel, South Jakarta, Wednesday (11/6/2019). BCA itself previously announced that it had signed a sale and purchase agreement that had received effective approval from the Financial Services Authority (OJK). With the contract of sale and purchase agreement, 99.99% of Bank Royal's shares have become the property of BCA and 0.01% belongs to PT BCA Finance. Jjaja explained, when acquiring the full shares of Bank Royal Indonesia, the core capital was only Rp 300 billion. While BCA bought around Rp. 988 billion of Bank Royal Indonesia's shares which went to the previous owner. "Yesterday, the point was Rp. 300 billion, we bought 2.8 times to be around Rp. 1 trillion. But we have to keep injecting it into Rp. 1 trillion in basic capital," he added. To serve digital banking, Bank Royal must become a BUKU 2. Meanwhile, to become a BUKU 2 bank, a minimum core capital of Rp 1 trillion is needed. "(Added) Rp 700 billion," he said. Jjaja estimates that the funds to be injected into the Bank Royal Indonesia around Rp 700 billion. The funds will be injected directly.
